Whitebaiters urged to stay safe and stick to the rules https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/08/17/whitebaiters-urged-to-stay-safe-and-stick-to-the-rules/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/08/17/whitebaiters-urged-to-stay-safe-and-stick-to-the-rules/ 'This year we’re encouraging whitebaiters to think about safety.' Fri, 16 Aug 2024 17:54:00 +0000 The Department of Conservation has urged whitebaiters to take care and stick to the rules once the season starts on September 1. Between 2019 and 2023, four people drowned while whitebaiting in New Zealand, None were wearing lifejackets.

Email him at drpayinda@gmail. com. This column provides general information, and is not a substitute for the medical advice of your own doctor. HBG 18Dec15 - DRUG: Police are understood to have found more than 5g of methamphetamine. PHOTO/FILE BTG 04Feb16 - SMOKED: 26 Bay state houses tested positive for P between 2013 and 2015. HBG 11Apr16 - CAUGHT: Ten per cent of those who tested positive for drugs had used methamphetamine. PHOTO/FILE BTG 30Jun16 - ADDICTION: A P pipe in use. BTG 22Jul16 - GETTING HIGH: Methamphetamine use appears to be on the rise in the Bay of Plenty.PHOTO/FILE BTG 27Aug16 - JAIL TIME: Haydee Richards celebrated her 40th birthday in jail, where a tear-stained letter from her son broke her heart. PHOTO/ANDREW WARNERGENERAL: Vanessa Caldwell heads the National Council for Addiction Treatment.SUPPORT: Haydee Richards, now 45, is a peer support worker for Phoenix, a drug counselling service which works with meth addicts in the community. PHOTO/ANDREW WARNERINJECTED: Although usually smoked using a small pipe, P can also be injected. PHOTO/GETTY IMAGES BTG 27Aug16 - BTG 30Aug16 - EPIDEMIC: A story on meth addiction in the Bay of Plenty Times Weekend has drawn a strong response from readers.PHOTO/FILE BTG 31Aug16 - FUNDAMENTAL FLAW: Problems with our society's foundations could be to blame for the "meth mess".
